This institution necessarily involves a great amount of responsibility, both in temporal and spiritual matters. It is of the greatest importance that this asylum for those who are diseased in body and mind shall be 
                                                                           28
such that Jesus, the mighty Healer, can preside in their midst, and all that is done may be under the control of his Spirit. All connected with this institution should qualify themselves for the faithful discharge of their God-given responsibilities. They should attend to every little duty with as much fidelity as to matters of greater importance. All should study prayerfully how they can themselves become most useful, and make this retreat for the sick a grand success.
